Articles.Content:
Let\'s race to the moon!

All mods welcome. First lander on the moon wins. Return trip not necessary.
you do know that the only flaw in your challenge is that people may use warp nacells and just blast a crater onto Mun?

Perhaps an admentment to the rules?

Must land without breakage. Your choice if you want to limit things to the not-stupidly-overpowered and require full rocket shots, too.

How bout this?

At least one of the three ended up on its feet.

ya know what would be cool if you left a stage on the moon and got back to Kerbin. Then build another rocket and went back and the part was still there. like if you left a stage in space then went back on another mission it was up there

On my way!

Still need to practice more I guess...

ya know what would be cool if you left a stage on the moon and got back to Kerbin. Then build another rocket and went back and the part was still there. like if you left a stage in space then went back on another mission it was up there

There are many bodies on the mun of mine....

ya know what would be cool if you left a stage on the moon and got back to Kerbin. Then build another rocket and went back and the part was still there. like if you left a stage in space then went back on another mission it was up there

That can\'t be possible, since every launch resets everything. Would be a good one if it is, though.
One day, we will have a persistent world in this game. It\'s planned.

ya know what would be cool if you left a stage on the moon and got back to Kerbin. Then build another rocket and went back and the part was still there. like if you left a stage in space then went back on another mission it was up there

You mean you want persistance? We all do.

Persistance = Space stations.
Wow! Just landed this on the Mun. Stage separation in orbit, followed by a short burn to the munar landscape.

Here my time to the Mun. Can be done faster, was a quite conservative/bad attempt.

5 Hours, 37 Minutes, 35 Seconds.

EDIT:

After a stay of about three minutes, Jeb said '\'tis boring!' and went back to Kerbin, for a total flying time of 8 Hours, 16 Minutes and 55 Seconds.

Challenge proposal: quickest to the Mun AND back?

I made this video awhile back of me getting to the moon fairly fast*.

*I may have cheated slightly
